events.message: The applicant has submitted a request for a personal loan to cover upcoming medical expenses and other unforeseen costs.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised under Personal Loan based on the applicant’s stated purpose involving medical bills.
An experienced loan officer was assigned to handle the case and guide the applicant through the process efficiently and empathetically.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the submitted documents to verify applicant identity and preliminary eligibility.
Additional documents were requested including recent medical bills, proof of income, and bank statements to support the application.
The applicant promptly submitted all the requested documents, including detailed medical invoices and income verification.
A standard credit check was completed, revealing a moderate credit score but a consistent history of timely payments.
The risk assessment determined the loan to have a medium risk profile, factoring in the applicant’s medical debt and credit score.
An offer detailing the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for review and acceptance.
The applicant provided positive feedback on the offer and requested minor clarifications regarding payment dates and fees.
Due to applicant questions about certain fees, the application was escalated to the senior loan approval committee for further review.
The senior committee approved the loan with adjustments to the fee structure, accommodating the applicant’s concerns fully.
The loan funds were disbursed into the applicant’s account, enabling them to manage their necessary medical bills and expenses.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant understood the repayment schedule and to answer any further questions.
The loan application case was formally closed after confirming the applicant’s satisfaction and completion of all necessary documentation.
